intro: Acer monspessulanum subf. obtentum, commonly known as the narrow-leaf maple, is a deciduous tree native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its slender, elongated leaves that are typically 5–12 cm long and have a distinct, serrated margin. The tree produces small, yellowish-green flowers in early spring, followed by winged seeds known as samaras. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or coastal areas. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for landscaping in temperate climates.
